title: Did Ringo Starr ever write a successful and well known Beatles song? - Quora

response.answer_text: Per Wikipedia , Starr is credited as the sole composer of two Beatles songs: "Octopus's Garden" and "Don't Pass Me By". He is credited as a co-writer of "What Goes On", "Flying" and "Dig It". I believe “Octopus’s Garden” is well-known and successful. I’ve know the song “Don’t Pass Me By’, but I went to see Ringo’s All Starr Band 3 times ,so I may think more of his song are famous . See the article. Ringo Starr - Wikipedia You can go to the Billboard website or wikipedia probably to see how high in the charts these songs got. However, I generally only see data on the album Abbey Road which contains “Octopus’s Garden” and not the song as single.

Octopus’s Garden is a fairly well known song from the Abbey Road album that still gets lots of airplay on the radio as opposed to Ringo’s earlier solo effort from the White Album, Don’t Pass Me By. Octopus’s Garden was actually covered by the Muppets who used to sing it on Sesame Street, although their version was obviously not as good as the Beatles’!

What Goes On (Rubber Soul) was labelled a Lennon-McCartney-Starkey (ie Starr) composition, although I’m not sure how much he brought to the table. Don’t Pass Me By (The Beatles) and Octopus’ Garden (Abbey Road) were credited solely to Ringo. Flying (Magical Mystery Tour) was credited to all 4 Beatles. Obviously, it goes without saying that, even if Ringo hadn’t written a note of music, his contributions were an essential part of what made the Beatles music so great (although the handful of songs which eitger featured no drummer or had McCartney on sticks were pretty good, too)

It is my understanding that Ringo came back from a short holiday spent with Peter Sellers on Sellers’ boat with the music and words to the chorus of Octopus’ Garden. The rest of the song was written with varying degrees of George Harrison’s help, depending on the source: George was either Ringo’s co writer, or George finished the song for Ringo.
Yes. A few but my personal favorite is Octopus‘s Garden. He even sang on that track
